direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are fundamental to object comparison and hash code generation, sharing similar control flow and dependency on the 'trueFirst' flag.
Both methods involve boolean logic and state management, though they serve different purposes (comparison vs. hash code generation).
Both methods depend on the 'trueFirst' state, influencing their respective outputs.

enhanced_by.reason: Initialization of the BooleanComparator with the 'trueFirst' flag is necessary to set up the state for hashCode() and other methods.
The equals() method should be invoked to ensure consistent hash code generation based on object equality.
The sortsTrueFirst() method can be used to verify the state used in hash code generation.
